intro: Centropogon poasensis, commonly known as the Poás orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Costa Rica. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in cloud forests, where it thrives in the cool, moist conditions of the montane environment. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, with a distinctive lip that is often marked with darker hues. Centropogon poasensis is a rare and specialized species, adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its habitat.
